textos_fuente.text: Daytona Beach Shores Aku Tiki Inn sells for $11.6 million News Sports Entertainment Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals BUSINESS Daytona Beach Shores Aku Tiki Inn sells for $11.6 million Lakeland investor buys Polynesian-themed Best Western hotel, an oceanfront landmark since the '60s Clayton Park clayton.park@news-jrnl.com DAYTONA BEACH SHORES — The Best Western Aku Tiki Inn, a beachside landmark since it opened in 1967, is under new ownership for the first time in its history. A local partnership that included the family of the late Tom Staed, a pioneering Daytona Beach hotelier who helped found Visit Florida, sold the oceanfront hotel at 2225 S. Atlantic Ave. in Daytona Beach Shores for $11.6 million, according to Volusia County property records. Local investor George Anderson was a minority stakeholder in the partnership that sold the 132-room hotel, which was built by Staed's father-in-law, the late Monroe Dodd. The sale closed in late August. The new owners are Lakeland physician Dr. Japinder Singh and his family. Singh bought the hotel via his newly incorporated Daytona Shores Hotels and Resorts LLC, also doing business as Aku Tiki Ltd., according to property records. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. The sale leaves the Staed family with just one hotel: the Bahama House at 2001 S. Atlantic Ave. in Daytona Beach Shores, which continues to be run by Blaine Lansberry, a daughter of the late Staed, and her husband Brian. During the early 1970s, when Staed was widely considered the Daytona Beach area's most prominent hotelier, he oversaw 11 hotels. "The sale was a repositioning of our assets," said Lansberry. "My husband Brian and I are keeping the Bahama House and plan to be active members of the hotel industry for many more years." Lansberry serves as vice chair of the Halifax Area Advertising Authority board, which oversees the Daytona Beach Area Convention & Visitors Bureau. The Best Western Aku Tiki Inn has been a local landmark in part because of its iconic Tiki God statue head at the entrance, which resembles the giant statue heads on Easter Island. Lansberry, whose parents bought the hotel in 2004 after the death of her grandparents, said, "I think the theme and name were inspired by the (1958) book "Aku Aku (The Secret of Easter Island)" by Thor Heyerdahl and the fact that a name starting with 'A' came first in the phone book." Former Daytona Beach Mayor Glenn Ritchey Sr. is a former musician whose band, The Mustangs, performed regularly at the Best Western Aku Tiki Inn in the late 1960s. "It was a wonderful place to go," recalled Ritchey, the CEO of Jon Hall Chevrolet. He added that his band was hired by Dodd. Ritchey said his band performed in the hotel's Trader's Lounge bar. "It was packed every night," he recalled. The Best Western Aku Tiki Inn has retained its staff with the exception of a change in general manager. The new GM is Jeff Van Diver, who previously worked in South Florida. He succeeds Steve Farley who recently left to become GM of the El Caribe hotel. The new owners also filled the director of sales and marketing position that had been vacant by hiring Tara Hart-Patterson. Hart-Patterson is no stranger to the area, having previously worked for the old Ocean Waters Management company that owned several oceanfront hotels in the Daytona Beach area. Staed, who died in 2013 at age 81, is the namesake of the new Tom Staed Veterans Memorial Bridge currently being built to replace the old Orange Avenue/Silver Beach drawbridge connecting Daytona Beach's City Island to the beachside. Local real estate observer Tim Davis of SVN Alliance Commercial Real Estate Advisors in Ormond Beach said the new owner likely will need to renovate the Best Western Aku Tiki Inn. "Oceanfront properties require so much maintainence because of the salt air," said Davis, who counts George Anderson as one of his clients. Davis said his understanding is that Singh is "very capable and knowledgeable about the hotel industry" and that he doesn't expect the new owner to change the Polynesian theme of the hotel. "it's neat and it's got a novel look." Davis said. If you want to get your own copy, the full travel guide for this destination is available to you offline* to bring along anywhere or print for your trip.​ *this will be downloaded as a PDF. Price €4,95 Purchase Europe Norway Oslo Bars & Nightlife Aku-Aku Overview Sections The City Do & See Restaurants Cafés Bars & Nightlife Shopping Hotels Tourist Information Aku-Aku The guide was updated: 2024-02-12 Aku-Aku is a popular Tiki Bar which transports its guests to a Polynesian oasis with its colourful decorations and atmosphere. Known for boasting Norway's largest rum selection, it offers an impressive array of cocktails that cater to every taste. Additionally, Aku-Aku also serves its own tap beer, and while the drinks may be a little pricey, they remain within the average price range for Oslo. Useful Information Address: Thorvald Meyers Gate 32, Oslo Website: www.akuaku.no Email: post@akuaku.no Digital Travel Guide Download Our travel guides are free to read and explore online. If you want to get your own copy, the full travel guide for this destination is available to you offline* to bring along anywhere or print for your trip.​ *this will be downloaded as a PDF. Price €4,95 Purchase Torggata Botaniske A lush cocktail bar with climbing plants covering the ceiling and its own greenhouse. The interiors are simple and classy while the superb cocktails are made with high-quality spirits and fresh ingredients grown in their greenhouse. The cocktail list changes according to the season. Read more Territoriet Territoriet is a wine bar with an intimate atmosphere offering almost 400 different wines, most of which are available by the glass. They have wines for every taste and price range that can be enjoyed with some cheese and finger food. All the music at Territoriet is played on vinyl and can be also chosen by customers. Read more Blå Blå is an alternative live music venue hosting numerous concerts that vary from indie to rock to jazz bands. They have both Norwegian and international artists performing early in the evenings and then, as time progresses, Blå turns into a vibrant nightclub with DJ sets. They also have a great outdoor terrace on the banks of the Akerselva River. Read more Aku-Aku Aku-Aku is a popular Tiki Bar which transports its guests to a Polynesian oasis with its colourful decorations and atmosphere. Known for boasting Norway's largest rum selection, it offers an impressive array of cocktails that cater to every taste. Additionally, Aku-Aku also serves its own tap beer, and while the drinks may be a little pricey, they remain within the average price range for Oslo. Read more Bar Boca The smallest bar in Oslo, Bar Boca is a cosy venue with 1950s decor serving some of the best cocktails in town. The selection is huge and the bartenders are always ready to make off-the-list cocktails on the spot. They also serve craft beer and wine. Read more The Villa The Villa is an underground club where live DJs spin electronic music on two different dance floors. Read more Dattera til Hagen Dattera Til Hagen is a colourful bar and café on two floors with a popular backyard beer garden. The café serves tapas, salads, burgers, and pasta. They also host regular events like concerts, improv theatre, and stand-ups. On the weekends, there are DJs on both floors. Read more The Dubliner Folk Pub The Dubliner Folk Pub brings the lively spirit of Ireland to the heart of Oslo with its large selection of beers and delicious pub fare, along with weekly live folk music and big-screen sports. Read more T.G.I. Fridays A well-established chain restaurant serving American food, beer, and cocktails in a festive and casual environment. Tiki Bar: Aku Aku Tiki Bar - Oslo | mytiki.life Welcome to the mytiki.life v2 beta. This is a work in progress and there may be some bugs. If you find any issues or have feedback send me an email: [email protected] . mytiki.life Home Tiki Mugs Swizzle Sticks Other Collectibles Collectors Creators Tiki Bars Home Tiki Bars Contact Request an update Sign in Create an account Search Quick Search Sign in Home Commercial Tiki Bars Aku Aku Tiki Bar - Oslo Grünerløkka, Oslo, Norway Add Visit Close Aku Aku Tiki Bar opened in May 2007, in the Grnerlkka neighborhood of Oslo. Some of the decor was on loan from the Kon-Tiki Museum, including a large canoe hanging from the ceiling. The walls were lined with straw matting. Classic tiki drinks were served in tiki mugs, and the music was a mix of Hawaiian and Exotica tunes. Closed April 6th, 2024. Details Type Bar Address Grünerløkka, Oslo, Norway Closed? Yes (Permanently) Links akuaku.no instagram.com facebook.com Gallery 3
                            Tiki Mugs Tiki Farm Hawaiian Lono - Purple - for the Aku Aku Tiki Bar in Oslo Tangata Tiki Mug - Green - with Aku Aku Tiki Bar Fire Decal Tiki Farm Yellow Moai with Aku Aku Tiki Bar Fire Decal 4
                            Visits TikiTropic – 18 Aug 2022 I had a amazing evenig there (two) just 4 days after 15th anniversary. The stuff was so friendly and the cocktails were fantastic. I also purchased one of the last Aku Aku mugs form to opening in 2007 witch they found in the cellar some days before. The interior is just exciting. Especially to see and to touch the original outrigger from Thor Heyerdals Kon Tiki is great. Tikihellcat – Date: Unknown Ken Odegard – Date: Unknown DrThundr – Date: Unknown Entry Meta Date Created 23 Apr 2020, 3:59:19 pm Date Updated 12 Apr 2024, 8:48:54 pm Author mytikilife Edit entry ⭐ Support mytiki.life with a supporter subscription! ⭐

Aku Aku Tiki Bar - The Orlando Life Home Spotlight Arts & Entertainment Food & Drink Lifestyle Gallery Health & Wellness Outdoors Sports & Rec Style & Fashion Business Aerospace & Defense Entrepreneurship & Startups Goods & Services Healthcare & Life Sciences Hospitality & Tourism Professional Networking & Growth Real Estate & Development Tech & Simulation Events ✕ No results See all results Aku Aku Tiki Bar Not Another Film Lab May 29, 2025 CityArts June 3, 2025 Published by Dave Vanz on June 3, 2025 Categories Tags Aku Aku Tiki Bar 431 East Central Blvd. Orlando, Fl 32801 Aku Aku is a tribute to one of the greatest eras in Tiki, the 1960’s . The Stardust Casino in glitzy Las Vegas opened its doors in 1958, soon after, it opened Aku Aku restaurant. With its beautiful tropical decor and its two Monolith Moais out front, it was the place to be, and the place to be seen. Here in Orlando, we have a perfect tribute in the Stardust Lounge with its wonderful Retro vibe and classic drink menu, and the Aku Aku tiki bar. Aku will transport you to a tropical paradise of bamboo and thatch and its meticulously made tropical libations. One of the most important ingredients to true tropical escapism is a good drink and a good setting. Here at Aku a great pride is taken in delivering you a proper cocktail. So after you choose your drink of desire, sit back, put down that phone and spark up a conversation with a stranger or take in all the glorious decor and items on the shelves. Who knows you may even see some things you never noticed before. Adventure Awaits! Website Share 0 Dave Vanz Proponent of strong, active and engaged communities.  I believe everything we create is an expression of who we are, and it's that belief that drives my curiosity to uncover the story's behind those shaping Orlando's Culture. I approach life with a drive for innovation and love connecting with like-minded, kind and ambitious people. Leave a Reply Cancel reply Your email address will not be published.
